intro: Neobartlettia brevipetiolata, commonly known as the short-stemmed barlettia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy blue-violet flowers. The plant features narrow, short-petioled leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. Its flowers are tubular with five lobes and are often clustered in inflorescences at the tips of the stems. Neobartlettia brevipetiolata is adapted to grow in moist, well-drained soils in shaded to partially sunny environments.
